body: When Joey DiPaolo took part in his high school graduation last week, the 17-year-old senior, like any ordinary student, mischievously wore baggy skater shorts and sneakers underneath a billowy purple gown. But he was facing a future unlike that of the 700 graduates who strode across a sun-baked football field in Staten Island. He did not, for
title: A Poster Child for AIDS Grows Into a National Spokesman

body: MANHATTAN DISTRICT 1 Battery Park, TriBeCa. Next meeting is April 15, 5:30 P.M.; The Regatta, Battery Park City, West Thames Street on the Esplanade; (212) 442-5050; Chairwoman: Anne Compoccia. title: Time to Tend the Grass Roots: Community Board Meetings Coming Up

body: The Scent of Memory Q. After a haircut and a shave, my barber splashes my face with a pale green liquid called Lilac Vegetal that, though soothing, has a musty floral scent that reminds me of my grandfather. Why do I still see it in so many New York barbershops? A. Tradition? The Edouard Pinaud Company, a Parisian fragrance manufacturer, began
title: F.Y.I.
